CodeList.Name: Microscopic Findings Test Details

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the additional descriptions of the test being performed to produce the microscopic result.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A score developed by Allred et al. (1998) and assigned based on the percent positivity of cells for a particular protein (Allred DC, Harvey JM, Berardo M, Clark GM. Prognostic and predictive factors in breast cancer by immunohistochemical analysis. Mod Pathol. 1998 Feb;11(2):155-68).

A score developed by Allred et al. (1998) and assigned based on the average staining intensity of cells for a particular protein (Allred DC, Harvey JM, Berardo M, Clark GM. Prognostic and predictive factors in breast cancer by immunohistochemical analysis. Mod Pathol. 1998 Feb;11(2):155-68).

The histopathological evaluation of staining in tissue based on the Allred scoring system (Allred DC, Harvey JM, Berardo M, Clark GM. Prognostic and predictive factors in breast cancer by immunohistochemical analysis. Mod Pathol. 1998 Feb;11(2):155-68).
The histopathological evaluation of the liver based on the Batts-Ludwig scoring system.

The histopathological evaluation of staining in tissue based on the H Score scoring system (McCarty KS Jr, Miller LS, Cox EB, et al. Estrogen receptor analyses: correlation of biochemical and immunohistochemical methods using monoclonal antireceptor antibodies. Arch Pathol Lab Med. 1985;109(8):716-721).
The histopathological evaluation of the liver based on the Ishak scoring system.
The histopathological evaluation of the liver based on the Knodell scoring system.
The histopathological evaluation of the liver based on the Meta-analysis of Histological Data in Viral Hepatitis (Metavir) scoring system.
A measurement of the proportion of cells that are positive for a given protein.
An assessment of the status of a biological specimen with regards to a given receptor.
The histopathological evaluation of the liver based on the Scheuer scoring system.
The degree or magnitude of staining within a biological specimen.

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Microscopic Findings Test Detail Terminology
